'Stripe' enables individuals and businesses to accept payments over the
internet. Co-founded by brothers Patrick and John Collison, the firm received
around $40 million USD in investment from Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz,
SV Angel, and PayPal founders Peter Thiel, and Elon Musk.

Stripe is dedicated to transparency, and will post legal requests from a third
party to stop doing business with a user to the Chilling Effects Clearinghouse
website. This practice contrasts with other payment processors such as PayPal
and Visa, whose policies on such matters lack transparency. [http://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2012/09/stripe-
transparency/ Payment Processor Stripe Buys Into Transparency and User Rights]
By Ryan Singel, Wired 09-28-12

Stripe charges a fee of 2.9% + $0.30 per successful charge. This rate is higher
than the rate charged by conventional credit card processors , but Stripe says
the total cost to its customers may be lower, because Stripe has no setup fees,
no monthly fees, no minimum charges, no validation fees, no card storage fees,
and no charge for failed payments. [https://stripe.com/us/help/pricing
"Stripe Pricing - United States"] 

According to Paul Graham, processing payments online is one of the most
important components of the world's infrastructure, and Stripe makes it much
less painful. Paul Graham. [http://paulgraham.com/schlep.html "Schlep
Blindness"]. 2012.
